#Text=Belfast

#Text=Belfast ( Béal Feirste , meaning " the mouth of the river Farset " ) is the capital and largest city of Northern Ireland and the second largest city on the island of Ireland after Dublin , the capital of the Republic of Ireland .

column1: #Text=Situated at the mouth of the River Lagan on Belfast Lough , Belfast is surrounded by low hills and has a population of 267,500 .
#Text=This figure refers only to the Belfast City Council area whose borders date back to the 1950s .
#Text=Since then the city has expanded and the population of the Belfast Metropolitan Urban Area which incorporates the surrounding suburbs and towns is 483,000 .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Belfast gained notoriety around the world during The Troubles ( 1969-1997 ) due to the frequency of gun and bomb attacks in the city .
#Text=Parts of Belfast were effectively no-go areas for security forces and therefore took on a lawless quality .
#Text=Today , the scars of Belfast 's troubled past make it an intriguing destination for travellers from around the world .
#Text=Since the signing of the Good Friday Agreement in 1998 , most of the politically-motivated violence has evaporated .

#Text=Belfast has since been awarded the accolade of being the safest city in the UK , based on a comparison of nation-wide crime figures , and , as part of its commitment to maintain peace , now seeks tourism from around the world , especially from countries other than the Irish Republic and the rest of the UK .

#Text=Those who live in Belfast tend to either absolutely love the city or loathe it , although the outsider 's perspective tends to be more forgiving , as Belfast was voted the fourth best city in the UK for a city break in the Guardian / Observer travel awards .

#Text=Needless to say , a visit to Belfast will be rewarded by a glimpse of a unique city that has finally begun to celebrate , rather than fight over , its place as a cultural meeting-point of Britain and Ireland .
#Text=Belfast is certainly exhibiting an air of determined optimism , with new hotels , bars , restaurants , clubs and shops opening at an incredible rate .
#Text=It is a city that is proud of its Victorian and Edwardian heritage and efforts to restore historic buildings are proving successful .

#Text=Tourism is on the increase in Northern Ireland , especially among those seeking a weekend away or short break in Ireland as Belfast can offer a significantly cheaper and more rewarding alternative to the busier , more expensive and more tourist-driven Dublin .

#Text=Belfast remains a great place to explore , as it is still relatively undiscovered compared with its neighbour in Dublin and is ideal for the tourist who enjoys a city with character , yet still has a raw , unspoilt energy .
#Text=A visit to the capital of Northern Ireland will provide a more stimulating trip as , once you scratch the surface , it is easy to see beyond the ethno-political conflict of past years .
#Text=It is a city which has changed dramatically in a decade due to this peace and prosperity and you will be greeted with warmth from locals who feel a new-found sense of pride in their city .

#Text=Indeed , the old cliche that you will be welcomed like an old friend by the patrons of Belfast 's many pubs and bars is actually true , as the locals love to find out what draws you to their little part of the world and , of course , they like the chance to share a little bit of their history with you !

#Text=Ask any local and they will tell you that a trip to Belfast will mean that you learn far more about the Irish and British psyche than a trip to a cheesy Irish pub in Dublin or on a tourist-orientated tour in London .
#Text=Some recent events , mostly the flag protests , may have put people off going to Belfast but violence is minimal and more or less peaceful .
#Text=In recent times , Belfast has also gained some degree of international fame for being the production centre of the famous television series Game of Thrones .
#Text=Tourist information
#Text=Visit Belfast Welcome Centre , 9 Donegall Square North , BT1 5GB ( just north of City Hall ) , ☏ +442890246609 .
#Text=To make the most of your time in the city your first point of contact should be the centrally located tourist information .
#Text=The first floor centre is accessible by elevator and escalator just to the left of the Boots Pharmacy .
#Text=The staff can provide maps , book accommodation and tours , recommend itineraries and places of interest and sell you overpriced and tacky souvenirs .
#Text=There is also a useful left luggage facility .
#Text=Fáilte Feirste Thiar ( Welcome West Belfast ) , 217 Falls Rd , ☏ +4428 9024-1100 .
#Text=Tourist Information office and welcome centre in the heart of the Falls .
#Text=The office distributes free maps , offers tours and general information about this part of the city .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Belfast has two airports .
#Text=Flying to Dublin is another option .
#Text=George Best Belfast City Airport
#Text=George Best Belfast City Airport ( BHD ) ( just two miles from Belfast 's city centre ) .
#Text=With magnificent views of the city of Belfast or Belfast Lough
#Text=on approach and departure , the airport principally serves routes to domestic UK and Ireland ; however , British Airways has extensive worldwide connections through the OneWorld Alliance .
#Text=Airlines using the airport include :
#Text=Aer Lingus to London Heathrow , Gatwick , Faro , Malaga , Palma de Mallorca
#Text=British Airways to London Heathrow
#Text=Citywing to Blackpool , Gloucestershire , Isle of Man .

#Text=flybe to Aberdeen , Birmingham , Bristol , Cardiff , Doncaster , Edinburgh , Exeter , Glasgow , Guernsey , Inverness , Jersey , Leeds/Bradford , Liverpool , London Gatwick , Newcastle , Nottingham EMA , Paris , Southampton , Manchester and Rennes .
#Text=The terminal is served every 20-30 minutes from 06:00 to 22:00 by the Metro 600 bus ( £2.50 single , £3.80 return ) .
#Text=Depending on traffic , the journey to Belfast 's Laganside Bus Centre and Europa Bus Centre should take no more than 15 minutes .
#Text=Alternatively , NIR trains serve the airport at Sydenham station twice an hour on the Portadown/Belfast/ Bangor line .
#Text=Upon arrival , ask at the airport information desk for a free shuttle ride to the station .
#Text=If arriving by train , the courtesy bus may be requested just inside the airport perimeter across the bridge from Sydenham station .
#Text=A single fare to Belfast Central , Botanic , City Hospital or Great Victoria Street costs £1.90 .
#Text=A single to Bangor costs £4.40 .
#Text=Taxis cost approximately £10 to most parts of the city and are an economical choice for small groups .
#Text=There is a surcharge of £2 that taxis add on if you are taking one from the airport .
#Text=Some drivers do n't make this clear until you 've reached your destination .
